summary:
Here are the 10 bullet points summarizing the ACT:

• **Purpose**: The purpose of this Act is to increase certain benefits and allowances for tax years 2026-27 to 2029-30, including the protected LCWRA amount and the ESA IR personal allowance.

• **Protected LCWRA amount**: The Department for Communities in Northern Ireland must exercise the power to increase the protected LCWRA amount for tax years 2026-27 to 2029-30 by the relevant CPI percentage.

• **ESA IR personal allowance**: The Department for Communities in Northern Ireland must exercise the power to increase the ESA IR personal allowance for tax years 2026-27 to 2029-30 by the relevant CPI percentage.

• **Relevant CPI percentage**: The relevant CPI percentage is the percentage by which the consumer prices index for the September before the start of the tax year is higher than it was for the September before that (or 0% if it is not higher).

• **Legacy employment and support allowance**: Paragraphs 1-3 apply to the amounts of the ESA IR personal allowance for tax years 2026-27 to 2029-30.

• **Standard allowance**: The standard allowance means the allowance to be included in an award of universal credit under Article 14(1) of the Welfare Reform (Northern Ireland) Order 2015.

• **Protected LCWRA amount and standard allowance**: For each combination of protected LCWRA amounts and standard allowances, the sum of those amounts for the current tax year must be at least the amount given by increasing the sum of those amounts for the previous tax year by the relevant CPI percentage.

• **Assessment periods and benefit weeks**: The term "assessment period" has the same meaning as in Part 2 of the Welfare Reform (Northern Ireland) Order 2015, and the term "benefit week" has the same meaning as in the Employment and Support Allowance Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2008.

• **CPI percentage calculation**: The CPI percentage is calculated by comparing the consumer prices index for the September before the start of the tax year to the consumer prices index for the September before that (or 0% if it is not higher).

• **Effective date and application**: This Act comes into force on 6 April 2026 and has effect in relation to assessment periods commencing on or after that date.
